Module pacman
Package pacman.model

Class MovableGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.shape.Shape
        • javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle
          • pacman.model.Grid
            • pacman.model.MovableGrid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ghost, Pacman
    public abstract class MovableGrid
extends Grid

    MovableGrid

    A MovableGrid is a Grid located in a Map with the ability to move.

    This class extends Grid.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Song Zhang
    See Also:
    Grid, Ghost, Pacman, Map, MovableGridType, Direction

    • Method Detail

      • isGoingToTouchGrids

        public boolean isGoingToTouchGrids​(Direction direction,
                                   java.util.Set<Grid> grids,
                                   double padding)
        Tests if this MovableGrid is going to touch a set of another given Grid.

        The algorithm: this method generates a mock grid in a position where this MovableGrid will be after the next move calculated based on the given direction, and checks if the mock one overlaps any grids in the given set.

        Parameters:
        direction - the current Direction of moving
        grids - a set of Grid to test if touching
        padding - a permissible error range in px indicating a range to allow overlapping to some extend, in px
        Returns:
        true if this MovableGrid is going to touch a set of another given Grid; false otherwise

      • isGoingToTouchGrids

        public boolean isGoingToTouchGrids​(Direction direction,
                                   java.util.Set<Grid> grids)
        Tests if this MovableGrid is going to touch a set of another given Grid.

        This method does the same thing as what isGoingToTouchGrids(Direction, Set, double) does. But with the third parameter padding being 1 (which is a recommended minimal value).

        Parameters:
        direction - the current Direction of moving
        grids - a set of Grid to test if touching
        Returns:
        true if this MovableGrid is going to touch a set of another given * Grid; false otherwise

      • handleMove

        public void handleMove​(Direction direction)
        Handles what should be done whenever moving.

        This method is called inside move(Direction). This doesn't do anything as default, and is designed to be overridden.

        Parameters:
        direction - the current direction of moving
        See Also:
        Ghost.handleMove(Direction), Pacman.handleMove(Direction)

      • handleCantMove

        public void handleCantMove​(Direction direction)
        Handles what should be done whenever cannot move.

        This method is called inside move(Direction). This doesn't do anything as default, and is designed to be overridden.

        Parameters:
        direction - the current direction of moving
        See Also:
        Ghost.handleCantMove(Direction)
